snippet: Samsung’s new iPad rival, the Galaxy Note 10.1, is loaded with features, but not all are well organized or practical.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column observes that Samsung’s new iPad rival, the Galaxy Note 10.1, is loaded with features, but not all are well organized or practical; notes it is designed to favor horizontal use, and its stylus can be used like pen on paper or like a computer mouse.
lead_paragraph: Samsung’s new iPad rival, the Galaxy Note 10.1, is loaded with features, but not all are well organized or practical.

headline.seo: Samsung’s Rival for the iPad Loads on the Features
headline.main: A Tablet Straining to Do It All
